Regulation No. 01/24/CEMAC/UMAC/COBAC dated December 20, 2024

Effective Date: January 1, 2025

"Agrément Unique" (Single License):
Grants CEMAC banks possibility of opening branches in six CEMAC countries with single authorization.

Allows credit establishment with license in one CEMAC member state to extend activities to another CEMAC member state.

Application Process:
1. Credit establishment submits request to Ministry of Finance of CEMAC member state where branch will be created
2. If Ministry has favorable opinion, forwards to COBAC
3. COBAC grants authorization

Limitation:
Only a branch can be created in another CEMAC member state. No longer possible to set up subsidiary or agency within single licence mechanism.

Compliance Period:
Credit establishments already holding single licence under former regulation have 12 months to comply with new provisions.

Significance:
Facilitates regional expansion for financial institutions while maintaining regulatory oversight.

Subject: Protection of consumers of banking products and services

Guaranteed Minimum Banking Services (GMBS):
Service Bancaire Minimum Garanti (SBMG) - List of banking services and products mandatorily free of charge to consumers.

Key Consumer Protection Measures:
1. Transparency in banking service charges
2. Banks must acknowledge complaints within 7 business days
3. Initial response to complaints within 14 days
4. Complete resolution within 45 days
5. Legal action must be initiated within 3 years of violation

Regulatory Oversight:
- COBAC oversees compliance
- Banks must uphold ethical practices
- Clear communication regarding fees, terms, conditions
- Mechanisms for addressing consumer complaints

  - Actual damages
  - Emotional distress
  - Punitive damages (in some cases)

Many bank staff and customers lack knowledge of which services are guaranteed free, leading to frequent misclassification of charges.
